data.title: Paul Davis, Sr. Obituary 2024
data.meta_description: A celebration of life for Paul Wesley Davis, Sr., 82, of West Monroe, Louisiana, will be held at 4:00 P.M., Monday, May 13, 2024, in the chapel of Mulhearn Funeral Home, West Mo...
data.text:
A celebration of life for Paul Wesley Davis, Sr., 82, of West Monroe, Louisiana, will be held at 4:00 P.M., Monday, May 13, 2024, in the chapel of Mulhearn Funeral Home, West Monroe, with Rev. Warren Ekhardt officiating. The visitation will be held from 2:00 P.M. until the time of service.

Mr. Davis was born on January 24, 1942, in Monroe, Louisiana, and passed away on May 4, 2024, in West Monroe, Louisiana.

Paul Davis was an air force veteran who loved his country, his family, and had a passion for fishing, racing, and traveling. To friends and family, he was loyal and as caring as they came. To know him was to adore him.

He was preceded in death by his parents, Wesley and Octavia Davis; sister, Kathy Alger; brother, Mike Davis, Sr.; and beloved pet, Angel.

Those left to cherish his memory are his wife, Suellen Davis; daughter, Karen Davis; son, Paul Davis, Jr. and his wife, Amy; siblings, Sharon Gill and her husband, Jimmy and Glen Davis; brother-in-law and close friend, Whitney Alger; grandchildren, Josh Booth, Tori Cline, and Brenna Davis; great grandchildren, Ashley Booth, Remington Cline, Karsyn Cline, and Davis Cline; nephews, Mike Davis, Jr., Wesley Davis, Christopher Gill, and Charles Gill; along with a host of nieces and nephews.
